titleStmt.title: The doctrine of faith. Or, The prime and principall points which a Christian is to know and believe. Handled in sundry sermons upon texts of scripture selected and chosen for the purpose. Wherein the method of the creed, (commonly called the Apostles Creed) is observed; and the articles thereof are confirmed, explained and applied, for the instructing of the ignorant, and the establishing of all in the truth. / By Christopher Cartwright, Minister of the Word at York.
titleStmt.author: Cartwright, Christopher, 1602-1658.

titleStmt.title: The doctrine of faith. Or, The prime and principall points which a Christian is to know and believe. Handled in sundry sermons upon texts of scripture selected and chosen for the purpose. Wherein the method of the creed, (commonly called the Apostles Creed) is observed; and the articles thereof are confirmed, explained and applied, for the instructing of the ignorant, and the establishing of all in the truth. / By Christopher Cartwright, Minister of the Word at York.
titleStmt.author: Cartwright, Christopher, 1602-1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.A. for Richard Lovvndes at the Unicorn on Lud-gate Hill over against Bell-Savage,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Mar. 23"; the imprint date has been altered in MS. to "1649".
Reproductions of the originals in the Union Theological Seminary, New York (Early English books) and the British Library (Thomason Tracts).
